info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 12:28PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Sanpete...northwestern Emery...northwestern Carbon...southern Wasatch and southeastern Utah Counties through 100 PM MDT... At 1227 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Mount Pleasant, or 15 miles northeast of Moroni, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Helper, Scofield, Colton, Castle Gate, Coal City, Milburn, Clear Creek and Soldier Summit. This includes US Route 6 between mile markers 210 and 238. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
